Package dontlookback

Class Settings

java.lang.Object
dontlookback.Settings
public class Settings extends Object
Game Configuration Settings Centralized configuration class that manages all game settings including: - Display resolution and graphics options - Gameplay mechanics (monster spawning, difficulty) - Debug and development modes - User interface preferences This class follows the singleton pattern for global settings access and provides both runtime configuration and build-time options.
Author:
Carl (original design), DLB Team (modernized implementation)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Settings()
    Initialize settings with default values Configures the game for development/testing mode by default

  • Constructor Details

    • Settings

      public Settings()
      Initialize settings with default values Configures the game for development/testing mode by default

  • Method Details

    • pausedState

      public static boolean pausedState()
      Check if the game is currently paused Uses modern state manager if available, falls back to legacy flag
      Returns:
      true if game is paused, false otherwise

    • setPaused

      public static void setPaused(boolean state)
      Set the game pause state Uses modern state manager if available, falls back to legacy flag
      Parameters:
      state - true to pause, false to resume

    • setStateManager

      public static void setStateManager(StateManager manager)
      Set the state manager reference (called by Graphics system)
      Parameters:
      manager - State manager instance

    • getStateManager

      public static StateManager getStateManager()
      Get the current state manager
      Returns:
      State manager instance or null if not initialized

    • testMode

      public static boolean testMode()
      Check if test mode is enabled
      Returns:
      true if in test mode, false for normal gameplay

    • setTest

      public static void setTest(boolean state)
      Enable or disable test mode
      Parameters:
      state - true to enable test mode, false for normal gameplay

    • resolution

      public static int[] resolution()
      Get the current screen resolution
      Returns:
      int array [width, height] representing screen resolution

    • admin

      public boolean admin()
      Check if administrator mode is enabled Administrator mode provides debug features and bypasses game restrictions
      Returns:
      true if admin mode is active, false otherwise Note: Admin unlock key: RaindeerFlotilla

    • debug

      public int debug()
      Get the current debug level
      Returns:
      debug level (0=off, 1=all info, 2=errors and critical only)

Don't Look Back - Horror Survival Game Engine

Built with Java 17, LWJGL 3.3.4, JBox2D | GitHub Repository | Report Issues
